title: Neil Woodford’s plan to float Oxford Nanopore looks ‘increasingly like a daydream’
text:
Neil Woodford’s route to exit one of his largest unlisted holdings, either through a float or as part of a private debt raising fundraising, is looking increasingly unlikely, according to City sources.

Life sciences company Oxford Nanopore will struggle to pursue a public listing or fundraising before the end of the year due to a sluggish IPO market and growing concern around private companies going public too soon, sources said.

A listing would have raised some much needed cash for the embattled fund manager, who is facing a liquidity crisis at his still-gated equity income fund and a debt deadline over at sister vehicle Woodford Patient Capital Trust.

In April, prior to the gating of his flagship...
description: Neil Woodford’s route to exit one of his largest unlisted holdings, either through a float or as part of a private debt raising fundraising, is looking increasingly unlikely, according to City sources.
